results.title: (dis)LOCATIONs symposium
results.creator_credit: Anna Munster, Dennis Del Favero, Jeffrey Shaw and Peter Weibel
results.brief_description:
A conference about fragmentation of ‘community’, urbanisation and the collapse of locale and neighbourhood, the erosion of the private spaces of the sexual and familial. These have emerged as thematics attributable to the restructuring and divergent flows of new information economies and mediascapes.

Featuring key note speakers including Jeffrey Shaw, Dennis Del Favero, Agnes Hegedus, Susan Norrie, Peter Weibel, Ursula Frohne, Lev Manovich.

results.title: Payback
results.creator_credit: Warwick Thornton, Penny McDonald and Blackfella Films
results.brief_description: Paddy, an old aboriginal man, has been in jail for twenty years. It is the day of his release. Paddy knows of two laws - white law and black law. The twenty years he has spent doing time for the white man’s law has been in preparation for this one - his payback day.

results.title: Ballet robotique
results.brief_description: This dynamic and playful work examines the use of robots in American industry. Exploiting the visual joys of the kinetic robotic motion set to a soundtrack by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra, this lightly humorous film show the industrial replacement of humans in tedious and hazardous tasks.

results.title: Recently 2
results.brief_description: In Jochen Kuchen’s playful animated short ‘Recently 2’ a man undertakes a new medical procedure that allows him to see everything inside his body. What he discovers however is an inner world brimming with memories, hopes, dreams and disillusionment. Beautifully conveyed by blending various styles of animation, this evocative work ultimately explores not the building blocks of the body, but those of the soul.

results.title: Grief
results.brief_description: Yonah, a taxi driver, wishes to bury his son who has committed suicide. But it is the start of the work day and there are not enough people at the funeral to form the requisite circle of mourners. We follow Yonah through the day and through the night, where after a series of encounters with a cross-section of urban Israelis, he returns by night to the grave site of his son. This subtle and exquisite Israeli film is itself a moving requiem for the relationship between a father and a son, and by extension, a lament for the contradictions and costs of the Jewish state.

results.title: The Hitch
results.creator_credit: Damon Herriman, Michael Booth and Luke Doolan
results.brief_description:
A driver picks up a hitchhiker on a deserted country road but it seems neither of them knows what lies ahead.

‘The Hitch’ was shot over 6 days in the outer suburbs of Sydney, Australia. Almost all cast and crew donated their time. The budget was approximately $20,000.

results.title: The French doors
results.creator_credit: Steve Ayson, Sam Brunette and Liz Garneau
results.brief_description: A man is renovating his home and adds a set of French doors to the house. When he wakes the next morning the world has taken a dramatic turn into the unknown.

results.title: Superpermanence
results.brief_description: superpermanence contains images that are magnifications of small sections of original frames, and plays with duplication, superimposition and colour manipulation.

results.title: Speed for thespians
results.brief_description: On a busy New York City bus a man and a woman begin to argue. Their language is florid and slightly surreal. Very soon we become aware that what we are witnessing is a scene from Russian playwright Anton Chekhov. And very soon the rushed New York commuters are captivated by the performance unfolding in front of their jaded eyes. This innovative adaptation of Chekhov is a delirious celebration of film, theatre and urban life. Nominated for an Academy Award as Best Short Fiction Drama at the 2002 Academy Awards.

results.title: The Golden Dark Age of Reason
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: An exploration of the beauty of New York’s classically inspired architecture; the Chrysler Building, a blimp passing over the Brooklyn Bridge, a young boy performing backflips on a street corner.
